YOU WANT TO MAKE SURE YOU GET THE BABIES OUT BEFORE THEY SHOW AGGRESSION. I RECENTLY FOUND ONE OF MY CRESTED GECKOS LITERALLY BITING ONE OF THE OTHER CRESTED GECKOS. On-screen text & graphics_caption: Devastating Egg Incubation Error
Audio & prosody_summary: The audio features a speaker recounting a significant error in egg incubation, specifically for hognose snake eggs, which resulted in the loss of two clutches. He details the incubation process, emphasizes the critical importance of daily moisture checks, and expresses his regret and embarrassment over the mistake, aiming to educate listeners to avoid similar issues.
On-screen text & graphics_on_screen_text: EVERYBODY MAKES MISTAKES, BUT SOME OF THEM ARE WORSE THAN OTHERS. I'M TALKING ABOUT AN EGG INCUBATION ERROR THAT I LOST AN ENTIRE CLUTCH, TWO CLUTCHES, OF HOGNOSE EGGS. WE'RE TALKING 40 EGGS IN TOTAL. WHAT YOU DO WITH HOGNOSE EGGS IS YOU CREATE A SUBSTRATE OR A MEDIUM. YOU MAKE IT JUST WET ENOUGH THAT IT CLUMPS INTO A BALL. BUT WHEN YOU SQUEEZE IT, IT DOESN'T DRIP. PUT IT INTO A CONTAINER, YOU PUT THE EGGS DOWN, YOU PUT A LID ON IT, AND THEN YOU EXCHANGE THE AIR EVERY FEW DAYS OR YOU POKE A HOLE IN THE CONTAINER. I DON'T KNOW IF IT WAS BECAUSE I DIDN'T EXCHANGE THE AIR OFTEN ENOUGH. I THINK THAT THE SUBSTRATE WAS MAYBE A LITTLE TOO MOIST. USUALLY IT'S MORE FORGIVING THAN THAT. THIS IS DEVASTATING. IT'S EMBARRASSING. I HATE TO ADMIT THAT THIS HAPPENED. SO, ALWAYS CHECK EVERY SINGLE DAY. IF YOU GO IN THERE AND YOU SEE TONS AND TONS OF MOISTURE ON THE TOP OF THE LID, TOO MOIST IN THERE. AND IF I CHECKED EVERY DAY, I PROBABLY WOULDN'T HAVE HAD THIS ISSUE. THAT'S ON ME, IT'S MY RESPONSIBILITY, BUT STILL, IT'S JUST KIND OF A GUTTING FEELING.

On-screen text & graphics_caption: Did I Rely Too Much On Automation In Reptile Keeping?

On-screen text & graphics_on_screen_text: THERE IS NOTHING IN THIS WORLD THAT MAKES THINGS EASIER WITH REPTILE KEEPING THAN AUTOMATION. THE SMART TIMERS THAT KIND OF TURN LIGHTS ON AND OFF, MISTERS, THINGS LIKE THAT. BUT IF YOU DON'T CHECK THAT IT'S FUNCTIONING, YOU'RE GONNA HAVE ISSUES. SO, FOR EXAMPLE, YOU HAVE A GREAT SUBFLOOR. IF THERE WAS A SPILL, IT WOULD EVAPORATE AND IT WOULDN'T CAUSE A HUGE MESS. IT WOULD GO TO DISSIPATE. THAT'S HOW IT'S MADE, RIGHT? SUPPOSING YOU HAVE A 20 GALLON PAIL THAT HAS A LEAK AT THE GASKET, SOMEHOW, AND IT ALL POURS OUT AND YOU DON'T NOTICE BECAUSE THERE'S ONLY A LITTLE PUDDLE IN THAT SECTION OF THE ROOM, WELL, YOUR MISTING SYSTEM MIGHT NOT HAVE WORKED FOR ABOUT A WEEK.
